metadata.feature_description: Applies content workflow settings to templates for approval processes

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Retrieve available workflows when creating page from template

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages and click Add Page
steps.expected: Add Page form should display with workflow dropdown
steps.actual: Add Page form displayed with Workflow dropdown showing available workflows

steps.action: Click on Workflow dropdown to view available workflows
steps.expected: Dropdown should show list of available workflows
steps.actual: Dropdown showed 5 workflows: Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Workflow, Test & <> "Special" Chars!

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set workflow for template-based page creation

steps.actual: Content Approval workflow was selected successfully

steps.action: Select a template (Workflow Test Template) from template selection
steps.expected: Template should be selectable with workflow already set
steps.actual: Template was selected with checkmark indicator, workflow remained set to Content Approval

steps.action: Enter page name 'Template Workflow Test Page' and click Add Page
steps.expected: Page should be created with template and workflow applied
steps.actual: Page was created successfully and browser navigated to the new page at /Template-Workflow-Test-Page

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify workflow completion status on created page

steps.action: Navigate back to Pages section and view created page settings
steps.expected: Page should show the workflow that was assigned during creation
steps.actual: Page settings showed Workflow dropdown with 'Content Approval' selected, confirming workflow was applied

observations: The header section displays 'Workflow: Off' as static text which does not update to reflect the actual workflow setting, but the Workflow dropdown correctly shows the assigned workflow.
Templates and workflows can be selected independently - templates do not have pre-assigned workflows; the workflow is set separately during page creation.

The code in WorkflowHelper.cs provides methods to check workflow status (IsWorkflowCompleted) and get workflow ID (GetTabWorkflowId), but these are used internally rather than exposed directly in the template UI.
